synopsis: Repeals law that prohibits certain establishments from providing or selling various single-use products to customers.
Requires manufacturers of electric vehicles to establish and implement electric vehicle battery management plans.
Directs DEP to develop guidelines concerning State and local government purchase of goods made from recycled material.
Establishes "Electric Vehicle Battery Recycling Task Force" to study ways to safely store, reuse, recycle, and dispose of used electric vehicle batteries.

Establishes "Electric Vehicle Battery Repurposing Fund" to support repurposing, remanufacturing, and recycling of electric vehicle batteries; dedicates amounts based on certain sales of electric vehicles.
Directs DEP to take certain actions concerning identification and testing of microplastics in drinking water, and requires DEP and BPU to study and promote use of microplastics removal technologies.
Eliminates prohibition on provision of single-use paper bags by grocery stores for delivery orders; requires certain retailers to repurpose cardboard boxes if feasible.
Requires certain recycling centers to report information about recycling markets and contamination to DEP.
Requires producers of packaging products sold in New Jersey to adopt and implement packaging product stewardship plans.
Requires DEP to develop, and solid waste management districts to use, standardized labels for recycling bins.
Prohibits sale, distribution, and import of certain products marketed as recyclable, unless DEP determines that products are widely recycled.
Exempts certain plastic materials processed at advanced plastic processing facilities from State laws regulating solid waste disposal and recycling.
Requires State entities to recycle certain materials and provide recycling bins in State buildings.
Codifies certain cannabis packaging requirements; establishes offense for minor gaining access to improperly stored cannabis products.

Establishes School Plastics Upcycling Grant Program in DEP to provide proportional awards to eligible schools based on pro rata share of plastics collected, by each school, for upcycling purposes; appropriates $5 million.
Requires producers of plastic packaging and certain other plastic products to reduce quantity of plastic sold; restricts additional substances under "Toxic Packaging Reduction Act."
Authorizes grocery stores to provide certain single-use paper carryout bags to customers.
Exempts sales of tangible personal property made from 100 percent post-recycled waste and recycled materials from sales and use tax.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to establish campaign that displays certain tourism advertisements through plastic wrapping of certain utility boxes located at intersections.
Prohibits procurement of single use plastic beverage containers by State and local government entities.

Eliminates prohibition on paper bags, and allows packaging options, for certain grocery orders for three years; requires program for disposition of reusable bags; extends timeframe for use of certain bags by food banks and pantries.

Directs DEP to select consultant to perform Statewide needs assessment regarding recycling of packaging products; establishes "Statewide Recycling Needs Assessment Advisory Council" in DEP; appropriates $500,000.
"Packaging and Paper Product Stewardship Act."*
Makes annual allocation of $500,000 from Clean Communities Program Fund for public outreach concerning single-use plastics reduction program permanent.

Prohibits food service business from providing single-use utensils and condiments to customers under certain circumstances and requires DEP to establish education campaign on benefits of reducing single-use utensils and condiments.*
Establishes recycling program for unused road sign posts.
Repeals law prohibiting sale or distribution of single-use plastic carryout bags, single-use paper carryout bags, polystyrene foam food service products, and single-use plastic straws.
Requires certain State-funded construction projects to utilize plastic construction materials that contain certain amounts of postconsumer recycled content.
Requires large organic waste generators to separate and recycle organic waste.
Requires DEP to regulate scrap metal facilities as recycling facilities.
Requires end-of-life recycling of solar and photovoltaic energy generation facilities and structures.
Establishes spill prevention and reporting requirements for certain facilities that handle plastic pellets.
Modifies provisions concerning licenses for persons who transport, broker, or process solid waste or soil and fill recyclable materials.
Urges DEP and EDA to establish plastics recycling marketplace.
Urges Governor to make appointments to "Advisory Council on Solid Waste Management" and "Recycling Market Development Council."
Requires producers of packaging products sold in New Jersey to adopt and implement packaging product stewardship plans.
Prohibits sale, distribution, and import of certain products marketed as recyclable, unless DEP determines that products are widely recycled.

Eliminates prohibition on paper bags, and allows packaging options, for certain grocery orders for three years; requires program for disposition of reusable bags; extends timeframe for use of certain bags by food banks and pantries.

Establishes "Electric Vehicle Battery Repurposing Fund" to support repurposing, remanufacturing, and recycling of electric vehicle batteries; dedicates amounts based on certain sales of electric vehicles.
Requires manufacturers of electric vehicles to establish and implement electric vehicle battery management plans.
Establishes conditions for net metering for authorized food waste recycling facilities.
Eliminates prohibition on provision of single-use paper bags by grocery stores for delivery orders; requires certain retailers to repurpose cardboard boxes if feasible.
Eliminates prohibition on provision of single-use paper and plastic carryout bags by grocery stores for delivery, pick-up or curbside pickup orders.
Directs DEP to adopt regulations concerning identification and testing of microplastics in drinking water.
Establishes School Plastics Upcycling Grant Program in DEP to provide proportional awards to eligible schools based on pro rata share of plastics collected, by each school, for upcycling purposes.*
Requires State entities to recycle certain materials and provide recycling bins in State buildings.
Directs DEP to develop guidelines concerning State and local government purchase of goods made from recycled material.
Requires producers of plastic packaging and certain other plastic products to reduce quantity of plastic sold; restricts additional substances under "Toxic Packaging Reduction Act."

Prohibits food service business from providing single-use utensils and condiments to customers under certain circumstances and requires DEP to establish education campaign on benefits of reducing single-use utensils and condiments.**
Repeals law that prohibits certain establishments from providing or selling various single-use products to customers.
"Packaging and Paper Product Stewardship Act."*
Requires end-of-life recycling of solar and photovoltaic energy generation facilities and structures.
Authorizes grocery stores to provide certain single-use paper carryout bags to customers.
Requires filtration system to capture microfibers and microplastics on washing machines sold on or after January 1, 2030.
Makes annual allocation of $500,000 from Clean Communities Program Fund for public outreach concerning single-use plastics reduction program permanent.
Requires certain State-funded construction projects to utilize plastic construction materials that contain certain amounts of postconsumer recycled content.

Directs DEP to select consultant to perform Statewide needs assessment regarding recycling of packaging products; establishes "Statewide Recycling Needs Assessment Advisory Council" in DEP; appropriates $500,000.
Repeals law prohibiting sale or distribution of single-use plastic carryout bags, single-use paper carryout bags, polystyrene foam food service products, and single-use plastic straws.
Exempts certain compostable plastic items from ban on single-use plastic carryout products.
Modifies provisions concerning licenses for persons who transport, broker, or process solid waste or soil and fill recyclable materials.
Urges Governor to make appointments to "Advisory Council on Solid Waste Management" and "Recycling Market Development Council."
Urges EPA to adopt drinking water standard for microplastics and nanoplastics.
